meanings.definition: To release or detach a clip or fastening.
meanings.sent1: She was unclipping the safety belt before getting out of the car.
meanings.sent2: I unclipped the leash to let the dog run freely in the park.
meanings.sent3: The magician unclipped the handcuffs with a swift motion, impressing the audience.
meanings.sent4: With a satisfying click, she unclipped the pen from her notebook, ready to write.
meanings.sent5: The hiker unclipping the heavy backpack felt an instant relief on his shoulders.

meanings.definition: The act of unfastening or releasing a clip.
meanings.sent1: The unclipping of the safety pin was necessary to open the box.
meanings.sent2: I heard the unclipping of the seatbelt as she prepared to exit the car.
meanings.sent3: The unclipping of the lock echoed through the empty hallway, signaling the end of the day.
meanings.sent4: The unclipping of the badge symbolized the end of his time at the company.
meanings.sent5: The unclipping of the necklace revealed a hidden compartment holding a precious gem.
